channel.title: NPR Topics: Culture
channel.description: Art and entertainment commentary plus interviews, book reviews, movie reviews, music reviews, comedy, and visual art. Subscribe to podcasts and follow trends in music, painting, art, architecture, photography, and design.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: The 'Melania' movie audience: Older white women
item.description: The pricey Amazon documentary did well in areas like Dallas, Tampa, Phoenix, Houston, Atlanta and West Palm Beach. Amazon says a docuseries is also on the way.
item.content:encoded:
The pricey Amazon documentary did well in areas like Dallas, Tampa, Phoenix, Houston, Atlanta and West Palm Beach. Amazon says a docuseries is also on the way.

(Image credit: Spencer Platt)
item.dc:creator: Ivy Buck

item.title: Trump says he's closing the Kennedy Center for renovations. We have questions
item.description: After President Trump announced plans for a "Complete Rebuilding" of the Kennedy Center in Washington, D.C., what exactly did he mean, and what does it mean for the arts?
item.content:encoded:
After President Trump announced plans for a "Complete Rebuilding" of the Kennedy Center in Washington, D.C., what exactly did he mean, and what does it mean for the arts?

(Image credit: Jim Watson)
item.dc:creator: Anastasia Tsioulcas

item.title: Meet Milo and Tina, the 'first openly Gen Z' Olympic mascots
item.description: The 2026 Olympics and Paralympics mascots are Milo and Tina, a pair of teenage, scarf-clad stoat siblings with big dreams. If you're wondering what a stoat is, you're in the right place.
item.content:encoded:
The 2026 Olympics and Paralympics mascots are Milo and Tina, a pair of teenage, scarf-clad stoat siblings with big dreams. If you're wondering what a stoat is, you're in the right place.

(Image credit: Gabriel Bouys)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: 'Blue Moon' pushed Ethan Hawke to his limit: 'That's a thrilling spot to be in'
item.description: "Every now and then you bump up against a part that presses you to the wall of your ability," Hawke says of his Oscar-nominated portrayal of lyricist Lorenz Hart. Originally broadcast Nov. 13, 2025.
item.content:encoded: "Every now and then you bump up against a part that presses you to the wall of your ability," Hawke says of his Oscar-nominated portrayal of lyricist Lorenz Hart. Originally broadcast Nov. 13, 2025.
item.dc:creator: Terry Gross

item.title: From the dumpster to the aisle: This wedding dress restorer brings gowns back to life
item.description: During the coronavirus pandemic, TikTok and Instagram creator Hobby Bobbins taught herself how to restore vintage dresses. Now, she's brought dozens of old wedding dresses back to life.
item.content:encoded:
During the coronavirus pandemic, TikTok and Instagram creator Hobby Bobbins taught herself how to restore vintage dresses. Now, she's brought dozens of old wedding dresses back to life.

(Image credit: George Street Photo & Video)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie

item.title: After being hit by a car, she was saved by a lavender bunny
item.description: Eight years ago, Joann Moschella was injured after her bicycle was hit by a car. That's when her unsung hero appeared, dressed in a furry lavender bunny suit.
item.content:encoded: Eight years ago, Joann Moschella was injured after her bicycle was hit by a car. That's when her unsung hero appeared, dressed in a furry lavender bunny suit.
item.dc:creator: Autumn Barnes

item.title: Kennedy Center to close for 2 years for construction in July, Trump says
item.description: President Trump says he will move to close Washington's Kennedy Center for two years. It follows a wave of cancellations since Trump ousted the previous leadership and added his name to the building.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump says he will move to close Washington's Kennedy Center for two years. It follows a wave of cancellations since Trump ousted the previous leadership and added his name to the building.

(Image credit: Mark Schiefelbein)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: A Vancouver museum shows failure is worth celebrating
item.description: At Vancouver's Museum of Personal Failure, artifacts celebrate a range of life's shortcomings. Some contributors say taking part in the project has been cathartic.
item.content:encoded: At Vancouver's Museum of Personal Failure, artifacts celebrate a range of life's shortcomings. Some contributors say taking part in the project has been cathartic.
item.dc:creator: Ayesha Rascoe

item.title: Sunday Puzzle: Rhyme Time
item.description: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe plays the puzzle with WBUR listener Laurie Rose and Weekend Edition Puzzlemaster Will Shortz.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe plays the puzzle with WBUR listener Laurie Rose and Weekend Edition Puzzlemaster Will Shortz.
item.dc:creator: Will Shortz

item.title: You already know the song — now, 'The One About the Blackbird' is also a picture book
item.description: In The One About the Blackbird, a young boy learns to play guitar from his grandfather. And there's one song in particular that they love…
item.content:encoded: In The One About the Blackbird, a young boy learns to play guitar from his grandfather. And there's one song in particular that they love…
item.dc:creator: Samantha Balaban
